flower.name: Rhododendron
flower.description: Rhododendron, meaning “red tree,” refers to the red flowers and woody growth of some species.

flower.name: Bellflower
flower.description: Tall bellflower, or American bellflower is found in the moist woodlands of North America.

flower.name: Orchid
flower.description: Orchidaceae is a member of Asparagales, an order of monocotyledonous flowering plants that also includes the asparagus and iris families.

flower.name: Rose
flower.description: Rose, (genus Rosa), genus of some 100 species of perennial shrubs in the rose family (Rosaceae).

flower.name: Gerbera Daisy
flower.description: Other daisies include the Gerbera daisy (Gerbera jamesonii) of the floral industry, marguerite daisy (Argyranthemum frutescens), painted lady daisy (Tanacetum coccineum), and pyrethrum daisy (Chrysanthemum cinerariifolium) and various members of the genera Chrysanthemum and Erigeron.

flower.name: Lily
flower.description: Lilies are among the oldest cultivated plants - the ancients raised the bulbs of this species for food.
